entry.title: SAP CodeJam Roadshow LATAM 2025 - recap
entry.content:
And that's a wrap..... Together with @josh_bentley, @RichHeilman, @thomas_jung, @SavioMarques, @jessicademarchi and @caiograbalos, we did a few SAP CodeJams in Latin America - four different cities (S√£o Paulo üáßüá∑, Lima üáµüá™, Mexico City üá≤üáΩ and Bogota üá®üá¥), various meetups and even joined the SAP Inside Track in S√£o Paulo. As part of the roadshow, we run the Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and ABAP Cloud & ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model CodeJams. It is always great to meet community members where they are and learn about the challenges they face in the different project and how SAP products enable them to tackle these.

 

This is the 2nd roadshow we've done in the region, and what a great experience it was. It was great to meet in person many SAP community members that I've interacted with online in the past. As well as seeing some familiar faces in the locations that we visited in the 1st LATAM roadshow.

S√£o Paulo üáßüá∑

@josh_bentley already share a recap of the events in Brazil and the first event in Peru.... so go ahead and check out all the photos he is sharing in the blog post - https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam-discussions/sap-codejam-roadshow-latam-2025-the-first-half-recap-being-present-is-about/td-p/14173987 

Lima üáµüá™

This is the first time we've done CodeJams in Lima, hosted at the SAP office. It was great to meet the local community and lovely to enjoy some of the local cuisine and coffee :-). Thanks to everyone who joined, even though there was a holiday right in the middle of the week #PeruEsClave.

 

 

 

 

 

Mexico City üá≤üáΩ

Two amazing events hosted at the IBM offices in Mexico City. I got the opportunity to meet SAP Champions - @Sandra_Solis and @MariettaLopez, whom I've interacted with in the past but never before met in person. Also, Devtoberfest winners - @Sandra_Solis and @eamarce23. Thanks to IBM for hosting, looking forward to more events in Mexico :-). The day after the CodeJams we also had the opportunity to visit the Museo Nacional de Antropologia time and get some time to learn about the different Mexican indigenous cultures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

Bogota üá®üá¥

Last city part of the 2nd LATAM CodeJam roadshow. The day before the events, there was some time to explore the city a bit and visit the Museo Botero, as well as the Casa de Moneda. The events took place @ the SAP office in Bogota. It was great to catch up with various previous CodeJam attendees, as well as meet some more community members. Special mention to the large crew who joined the CodeJams from Globant (Bogota and Cali).... next time we will organise the event at the Globant office haha

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 


 

Personally, I always feel energised after connecting with the large Latin American SAP community and I know that it is also a great experience for the other advocates that have joined the roadshows. I'm already looking forward to next year and doing more CodeJams in the region.

entry.title: Give a Kudo, Get a Badge
entry.content:
Last week, we began to assign badges based on the number of kudos a member received. But what about the members who kindly grant kudos? Don‚Äôt they deserve some recognition, too?

We think so, and that‚Äôs why, starting tomorrow (Wednesday, September 3), we‚Äôre launching our latest progression set ‚Äì based on kudos given.

As with the other badges that we recently rolled out, this set contains five badges, the first of which has been available since the launch of our current platform last year. The rest are new. You make your way through the set as your activity meets the associated criteria. With these badges, you‚Äôll acquire the second one after giving 30 kudos, the third after 75, the fourth after 200, and the fifth and final after 500.

That‚Äôs a whole lot of kudos clicked!

Badges will start appearing in people‚Äôs ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù area tomorrow ‚Äì and we‚Äôll require a few hours to assign them all. Since we‚Äôll once again award them retroactively, you can already anticipate what you‚Äôll attain (if anything) by looking at your accrued activity. How? Here‚Äôs a refresher.

After logging in, select ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù from the dropdown in the upper right.

Once you‚Äôve navigated to your ‚ÄúMy content‚Äù page, look for the gray box at the top. This area contains several stats, including ‚ÄúKudos given.‚Äù As an example, I‚Äôm once again turning to my anonymous friend (who was the source of my screenshots for previous posts).

With more than 1,700 kudos given, he‚Äôll complete the set during tomorrow‚Äôs rollout (having surpassed the threshold for all of the new badges‚Ä¶and then some!).

That‚Äôs some serious gold-medal kudo judo!

Now if you were so inclined, you could go give hundreds of kudos right now (although your finger might get sore from clicking all those thumbs), ensuring that you also complete the set tomorrow. But your kudos carry way more weight when you dole them out deservingly. Why give them away randomly when you can make another member‚Äôs day by delivering a kudo that sincerely indicates that you read and appreciated his or her content?

As someone who writes frequently for SAP Community, I can attest to the warm and fuzzy feeling that comes from a kudo. Clicking that thumb is such a simple act, yet its impact is undeniable for the recipient. It sends the message: ‚ÄúI like what you did. Thank you.‚Äù For that reason, I‚Äôm glad to see that our community‚Äôs cool kudo givers can earn rewards for their generosity.

If you expect to gain one or more ‚Äúkudos given‚Äù badges tomorrow, then let me give you a big thumbs up in advance. Also, as a reminder: If you don‚Äôt see your badges by Thursday, September 4, please log out and in again. And if you haven‚Äôt racked up the necessary numbers yet for the full set, don‚Äôt worry. You can always win the badges later by reading and reacting to contributions throughout the community.  

In conclusion: Keep the thumbing coming for the content that you like, and make sure to check back next week. We plan to unveil more progression badge sets in September, and we‚Äôll announce them weekly right here in What‚Äôs New. In the meantime, remain an active, positive member, and you may find yourself surprised with even more badges this month.

entry.title: SAP Labs S√£o Leopoldo: Desde Paraguay Visitamos las instalaciones de SAP LABS
entry.content:
Nuestra aventura √©pica en SAP Labs S√£o LeopoldoüöÄ
Spoiler alert: Fue incre√≠ble y queremos contarte todo

üìÖTodo empez√≥ con un plan (y mucha emoci√≥n)

Imag√≠nate esto: un email llega a tu bandeja de entrada y Matheus Souza te invita a conocer SAP Labs en Brasil para aprender sobre Inteligencia Artificial. ¬øTu respuesta? ¬°S√ç, por favor! üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
As√≠ comenz√≥ nuestra aventura. Meses de planificaci√≥n, coordinaci√≥n de agendas, documentos, rutas, hoteles... pero con una sonrisa en la cara porque sab√≠amos que esto iba a ser √âPICO.

üèé15 horas de carretera = 15 horas de aventuras

¬øConoces esa sensaci√≥n cuando est√°s tan emocionado por algo que hasta un viaje de 15 horas se siente como una aventura? Pues eso nos pas√≥.
Desde Ciudad del Este, Paraguay hasta S√£o Leopoldo fueron 15 horas en carretera llenas de:

  • Conversaciones sobre IA (obvio)
  • Predicciones sobre lo que √≠bamos a aprender
  • Chistes internos del equipo
  • Muchas paradas para caf√© ‚òï

 

Algunos Manejan, otros Duermen!

Parada t√©cnica en Porto Alegre: Cultura + Diversi√≥n

Antes del entrenamiento intensivo, nos dimos una vuelta por Porto Alegre. ¬°Qu√© ciudad m√°s linda!

Lo mejor de todo: conocer la cultura local, probar comida brasile√±a aut√©ntica, y preparar nuestras mentes para absorber todo el conocimiento que ven√≠a.

Algunos se olvidaron los lentes de Sol üòé

Paseo Obligatorio en Sao Leopoldo

Hasta participamos de Una marat√≥n!



Primera vista de SAP Labs: "¬øEsto es real?"

Llegar a SAP Labs fue como entrar a una pel√≠cula de ciencia ficci√≥n. Edificios modernos, tecnolog√≠a por todos lados, y esa sensaci√≥n de "aqu√≠ es donde nace el futuro". Nos recibieron con la sonrisa m√°s c√°lida del mundo y pensamos: "Esto va a estar buen√≠simo"

 

Lunes y Martes: Modo aprendizaje ACTIVADO

D√≠a 1: "¬°Esto es el futuro!"

Lunes por la ma√±ana. Caf√© en mano. Energ√≠a al 100%. Ready para aprender.

Lo que vimos (y nos vol√≥ la cabeza):

  • Introdu√ß√£o a metodologia AI Journey
  • Business AI SAP 
  • Joule for consultant
  • Joule for developers
  • Hands on: Joule on SAP build code

D√≠a 2: "Ok, ahora s√≠ que estamos en otra liga"

Martes. M√°s caf√©. M√°s energ√≠a. Listos para el siguiente level.

Round 2 de conocimiento: 

  • Discovery Center
  • SAP Business AI Use cases
  • AI no BTP
  • Hands on: RAG with Hana 

 

Me Toco rendir en el frente! üòÇ

üåÉLas noches: Donde nacen las mejores conversaciones

Si pensabas que todo era trabajo, te equivocaste. Las noches en S√£o Leopoldo fueron LEGENDARIAS.

El plan: Salir a cenar, conocer la ciudad, probar comida local.

 Conocimiento nivel PRO: Ahora hablamos de IA como expertos (bueno, casi)

 Inspiraci√≥n desbloqueada: Volvimos con mil ideas para implementar en Kuaatec

 Conexiones humanas: Hicimos amigos que est√°n a miles de kil√≥metros pero se sienten s√∫per cerca

 Visi√≥n expandida: Entendimos que el futuro no es "alg√∫n d√≠a", es AHORA

 

¬°Los esperamos en Paraguay!

Crecer junto a las personas es el mayor resultado de todos - y esto lo comprobamos en primera persona.

Brasil nos abri√≥ sus puertas, nos ense√±√≥, nos inspir√≥ y nos hizo sentir como en casa. Ahora queremos devolver el favor.

¬°Equipo SAP, los esperamos en Paraguay! 

Las puertas de Kuaatec siempre estar√°n abiertas para ustedes. ¬°Vengan cuando quieran!


Gracias infinitas (en serio, INFINITAS)

entry.title: üì¢ SAP Inside Track Pune 2025 ‚Äì The Community is Back, Stronger than Ever!
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community in Puneüëã

We are thrilled to share that SAP Inside Track (SIT) Pune is returning for its second edition on 11th October 2025 at SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune. üöÄ

After the overwhelming response to the first edition, where we witnessed unmatched energy, knowledge sharing, and community bonding, we‚Äôre excited to bring the SAP ecosystem in Pune together once again ‚Äì this time, with an even bigger focus and a more impactful agenda.

üåüWhat is SAP Inside Track?

For those new to it, SAP Inside Track (SIT) is a community-driven event where SAP professionals, experts, and enthusiasts come together to:

  • Share knowledge and insights

  • Learn about the latest innovations in the SAP ecosystem

  • Discuss real-world challenges and solutions

  • Connect and collaborate with like-minded professionals

It‚Äôs an event for the community, by the community, and Pune has already shown how vibrant and powerful this community can be.

 

ü§ñSpotlight Theme for 2025: Business AI in SAP

This year, we‚Äôre placing a strong spotlight on Business AI in SAP ‚Äì exploring how AI is no longer just a buzzword but a powerful enabler across the SAP landscape.

üîéKey Topics You Can Expect:

‚úîÔ∏èSAP AI Strategy & Roadmap
‚úîÔ∏èEmbedded AI in SAP Solutions
‚úîÔ∏èBuilding with SAP AI Agents
‚úîÔ∏èBusiness AI Solutions (SAP)
‚úîÔ∏èSAP Business Data Cloud
‚úîÔ∏èSAP Business Technology Platform
‚úîÔ∏èAI Innovations: Partners & Customers

 

üîëWhy You Should Attend

Attending SIT Pune 2025 means being part of something bigger:
üé§Expert-Led Sessions ‚Äì Hear directly from thought leaders and SAP experts.
ü§ùNetworking Opportunities ‚Äì Build valuable connections with professionals, customers, and partners.
üí°Real-World Insights ‚Äì Learn from success stories, project experiences, and innovation journeys.
üéØCommunity Spirit ‚Äì Experience the energy of Pune‚Äôs SAP community, where collaboration drives growth.

 

üìÖEvent Details

  • Date: 11th October 2025

  • Venue: SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune

  • Registration: Register here

‚ö†Ô∏èPlease note: Seats are limited ‚Äì so make sure you secure your spot early.

 

üôåBe Part of the Movement

SAP Inside Track is not just an event ‚Äì it‚Äôs a movement powered by the passion and collaboration of the SAP community.

Whether you are a developer, architect, consultant, customer, partner, or simply an SAP enthusiast ‚Äì this is your chance to:

  • Learn something new

  • Share your own experiences

  • Expand your network

  • And most importantly, celebrate the spirit of community

We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you to SIT Pune 2025. Let‚Äôs come together for an unforgettable day of Business AI, SAP learning, and community bonding! üöÄ

See you in Pune! üí°

Regards,

SAP Community Pune - Core Team

entry.title: Call for Speakers - SAP Inside Track Barcelona 2025 - Nov 14th
entry.content:

entry.title: SAP Community Team Spotlight: Josh Bentley - September 2025 Edition
entry.content:
You probably have already seen the past interviews of this series (one / two / three / four / five / six / seven / eight ) which were done by my colleague Marco Santos. Today I am very excited to introduce you to another amazing person behind the SAP Community platform. Here we are with another SAP Community Spotlight, @josh_bentley ! 

 

Fatemeh Zarei (FZ): Hi Josh! Thank you so much for joining us today. To kick things off - would you like to tell us a little bit about your iconic blue beard? How did that all start?

Josh Bentley: So, every superhero has their own origin story - mine's just a little less dramatic. I‚Äôve been talking about technology for nearly 25 years, and in 2018, I joined the Developer Advocates team after leaving the Cloud Center of Excellence. At a conference - SAP TechEd - the women on our team had all these vibrant hair colors and teased us guys for being boring. I thought, ‚ÄúWhy is it only the women showing personality?‚Äù But I don‚Äôt have hair - I‚Äôm bald! So, one of them said, ‚ÄúWell, you can dye your beard.‚Äù I didn‚Äôt take it seriously at first, but before SAP TechEd in 2019, I thought, "Why not?" I texted her for tips, used paper towels to mix colors until I got close to SAP blue, and I‚Äôve kept it ever since. This October marks six years! What keeps me doing it is not just for my ego boost but for the smiles I get from others and the joy they truly show me when they see me.

FZ: That‚Äôs fantastic! Now, shifting gears a bit - how did you first get involved with the SAP Community?

Josh: That goes back to my pre-sales days, around 2011 or 2012, when we had the ‚ÄúBlog It Forward‚Äù campaign that Moshe Naveh started. I was a solution engineer at the time and joined in by answering the campaign questions, then tagging others. That was my first real blog post and entry into the community. I wasn‚Äôt one of the founders or key players at the start - it was more of a resource to find answers or share thoughts. But that‚Äôs where it began for me.

FZ: What's your current role on the SAP Community team, and what does a typical day look like?

Josh: These days, I focus on promoting community advocacy. I help highlight what‚Äôs working and where we can improve. My work is all about connecting with people - online and in person - and making sure their voices are heard. There‚Äôs no ‚Äútypical‚Äù day, but it involves a mix of content creation, listening to feedback, and strategizing how to make the community better.

FZ: You‚Äôve done so much! What‚Äôs one part of the SAP community experience that you‚Äôre particularly proud of?

Josh: It‚Äôs hard to pick one, but I‚Äôll mention three chapters in my SAP life. First, I was part of the team that transitioned SAP from BlackBerry to Apple devices, which was a major enterprise shift. We tackled security, analytics access, BYOD - it was a huge cross-functional effort. Then in pre-sales, I traveled extensively and gave technical demos to some of the biggest companies in the world. I got comfortable and confident in front of customers because I prepared so thoroughly - ‚Äúsharpening the axe,‚Äù as they say. And in the Developer Advocate role, one big highlight was being trusted to go on stage for SAP TechEd, even during the COVID era when we broadcasted from Frankfurt. Being able to be myself and present on a global stage was unforgettable.

FZ: Amazing. Do you have a favorite or most memorable moment in the community?

Josh: One standout was my first SAP TechEd in Barcelona. Being in a role where I get to visit an amazing city like that is something else, but the real magic was seeing the show floor and the scale of how many SAP mentors and other legacy members made the trip. Some of my first SAP selfies with people I would work with for years were taken at that event.

FZ: How do you stay in tune with the community‚Äôs needs and feedback?

Josh: Three main ways. First, in-person events. That‚Äôs where people are really open. Online, they might not comment or engage as much, but in person they‚Äôll say, ‚ÄúHey, I saw your video!‚Äù Second, I post on YouTube and LinkedIn to keep communication flowing. Third, I look at outside platforms like Reddit or Stack Overflow to see what SAP techies are saying in the wild.

FZ: If you could wave a magic wand and change one thing in the community, what would it be?

Josh: I‚Äôd love to see more people offering constructive feedback - with solutions in mind. Not just ‚Äúthis is broken,‚Äù but ‚Äúhere‚Äôs how it could be better.‚Äù I know we can‚Äôt always implement every suggestion - due to technology limitations or staffing - but the community is stronger when members help shape it. The community is bigger than just a website. It‚Äôs every conversation, every event. And we need our members to be co-owners in it.

FZ: And one final question - do you have any advice for those new to SAP or the SAP Community, like me?

Josh: Absolutely. Be your own advocate. No one else is going to push you harder than you will. Learn how your managers listen. In meetings - listen first. Figure out how you can add value. People ask how they can have a role like mine. I say, there are two ways: either start a company and create your own path - or gain experience over time. I didn‚Äôt go to school for SAP. I started wiring buildings, setting up IT systems, and just kept learning. Over time, I built a brand and a reputation for being honest, responsive, and knowledgeable. Have a point of view - or put in the work. There‚Äôs no shortcut. Just engage with kindness and curiosity, and the rest will come.

FZ:  What a wonderful way to wrap things up! Thank you so much, Josh, for joining me today and sharing your SAP journey with us. It‚Äôs been a real pleasure having you here.

Josh: Thanks, Fatemeh. I really enjoyed our conversation.

entry.title: üåü Welcome to the SAP Community Group Nigeria! üåü
entry.content:
Hello SAP Nigeria Enthusiasts! üëã

We‚Äôre super excited to kick off the SAP Community Group in Nigeria, a space created for collaboration, learning, and innovation within our local SAP ecosystem. Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned SAP professional, just starting out, or a business leader using SAP solutions to make an impact, this community is for you. Together, we‚Äôll share ideas, learn from each other, and build strong connections that grow the SAP network across Nigeria.

Our vision is to create a vibrant and dynamic community that thrives on collaboration and continuous learning. By sharing your knowledge, engaging in discussions, and supporting one another, we can build a strong SAP ecosystem that not only empowers professionals in Nigeria but also contributes to the global SAP family.

Why join the SAP Community Nigeria Group?
Here‚Äôs what you can look forward to:
üîπLocal Meetups & Events ‚Äì From informal gatherings to SAP-focused workshops and knowledge sessions, we‚Äôll create opportunities to connect in person.
üîπKnowledge Sharing ‚Äì Publish blogs, ask questions, and share insights on SAP solutions and innovations. Your contributions form the backbone of this community.
üîπNetworking & Growth ‚Äì Build relationships with SAP experts, professionals, and enthusiasts across Nigeria and beyond.
üîπCelebrate Success Stories ‚Äì Share how SAP is driving transformation in your career, business, or industry‚Äîwe want to spotlight local heroes.
How you can get involved

üëâ Join the Group  
üëâPost your Introduction  (tell us about your SAP journey, location, and interests)

üëâStay tuned for events and discussions that bring learning and collaboration to life
Let‚Äôs Build the Future ‚Äì Together
This community will only be as strong as the people in it. By sharing your knowledge, engaging in discussions, and supporting others, you‚Äôll help us build a vibrant SAP ecosystem in Nigeria.

üöÄTogether, let‚Äôs make the SAP Community Nigeria a hub of innovation, collaboration, and growth!

About the Initiator 

Charles Nwankwo is an SAP PP/QM Consultant with over six years of professional experience. His career has spanned multiple industries, including manufacturing, consumer goods, beverages, pharmaceuticals, and chemicals. He has contributed to several end-to-end SAP projects, ranging from Greenfield and Brownfield S/4HANA implementations to public cloud deployments. Beyond technical expertise, these experiences have deepened his understanding of the challenges and opportunities that organizations face during SAP transformation.

Driven by a passion for collaboration, he established this community to create a platform where SAP professionals in Nigeria can connect, exchange insights, and collectively drive innovation.

@lauraschmitz #SAP#SAPCommunityNigeria

entry.title: CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE
entry.content:
Hello All,

In this Blog I would like to share some knowledge on how to Create a basic CAPM application using Sap Business Application Studio and we are going to use the SAP S/4 Hana system to connect and fetch the data.

Lets Divide this Blog into three sections:

1. Prerequisites

2.  Connecting with S/4 HANA Data Base.

3.CRUD Operations

In this Blog lets see what are all the subscriptions and settings to be done to start our application.

Let.. Set.. Go!!

NOTE: May Be This Blog Seems To Be Lengthy, Still Give It A Try U Will Surely Love IT üòÄ

 

 

 

Step1: Lets Subscribe to SAP HANA CLOUD:

Open your SAP BTP trial account and navigate to Service Market Place. Search for S/4 Hana Cloud

 

After Selecting HANA Cloud, you will get the screen like below and Please click on Create.  

 

 

 

Click on Tools and then Create.

 

Once you click on View Subscription , here it shows as below image

 

Note: Remember after subscribing any service you should add security because every service will have its own Role Collections.

Now lets navigate to Users and Click on Default Identity Provider.

 

 

Click on Assign Role Collections, there you can find roles related to Hana cloud( You will find all the roles for the services that are subscribed).

 

 

Select them and click and assign.

 

You can find them under your role collections. Now you have your HANA DB. Lets open it.

 

Step2: Open SAP HANA Cloud and Lets Create Instance.

 

Click on Create Instance and then select HANA Cloud DB.

 

 

 

Here its asking us from which environment our service is going to run, So we need to sign in to Cloud Foundry with your Default Identity Provider Credentials( your email id).Then it returns you this Message.

 

 

 

 

 

Select your space which is default given as dev ( I renamed its as Dev). Instance name can be anything of your choice.

 

 

Enter any password of your choice.

Now leave the next step as it is with storage of 16gb and next please select allow all IP addresses so that it will not block any.

 

 

Click on the three dots over there and there you will find an option to Start. In 10 to 15min your instance would be running.

 

 

Step 3: Setup Work Zone(Fiori Launch Pad):

Search in Market Place > Work Zone

 

Click Create 

 

Please select the Plan as Subscriptions > standard. 

 

Our Subscription would be in progress.

 

 

Note: If this error exists, please subscribe to your Cloud Identity Services.

If you get this, please add trust configuration. So follow the steps below

Initially follow the same process of Subscribing Cloud Identity Provider User Role Collections

Fix: Configure OIDC Trust in SAP BTP

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit
    Go to your subaccount where you want to subscribe to the application.
  2. Go to Security ‚Üí Trust Configuration
    This is where you manage identity provider (IdP) trust settings.
  3. Add SAP Cloud Identity Services as an OIDC IdP
    • Click Establish Trust.
    • Choose SAP Cloud Identity Services.
    • Select OpenID Connect (not SAML).
    • Enter the required details (Issuer URL, Client ID, etc.) ‚Äî if you have Identity Authentication service (IAS) set up, you can copy these from there.
  4. Set as Default for Business Users

                  ÔÇ∑ Make sure the new OIDC IdP is assigned to business users in your subaccount.

  1. Save & Retry Subscription
    Go back to the subscription page and try again.

Assign the Role collections to users what are all available. Check them all and Click on Assign.

Step 4: CREATE A HANA DB INSTANCE:

Navigate to Service Market Place > Select HANA DB > Create > Under Plan select the Instance.

 

Step 5: Subscribe to Business Application Studio.

Note: By default SAP Business Application Studio would be subscribed. If not subscribe it by yourself.

 

Are you all done!! Lets get into next Episode soon...

References:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

https://help.sap.com/fiori_bs2013/helpdata/en/a7/1564526ba1f25fe10000000a423f68/content.htm?no_cache...

Hope it‚Äôs helpful üòâ

 

Thanks,
Divya MANDAVA.

entry.title: SAP Community Hobbies Series: Mind Your Step (Walking and Hiking)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm Moshe Naveh from the SAP Community team. Today, I'm excited to kick off a new SAP Community virtual journey: a blogging series focused on the passions and hobbies of our community members. In this series, community members will share about themselves, their hobbies, how they got started, how they incorporate them into their routine, and how you can learn them as well. This series will be enriched with fun stories, inspiring anecdotes, images, videos, and more. Each community member will tag another member to join the series via their mutual interest. For now we've lined up community members with the following hobbies: painting, Mindfulness, Yoga, skydiving, running, and more! 

I want to start the series by sharing a hobby that has been my passion for a long time: long walks and hiking. It all started when I did my first step, around the age of eighteen monthsüòâ. However, when I was a teenager I started taking long walks. I used to love to walk on the beach just before the sun switched turns with the moon. There was a sculpture of a bird that always inspired and reminded me that I'm free to go wherever I want. 

The title of this blog post, "Mind Your Step," reflects my state of mind when I walk. I try to be mindful of every step I make. Each step not only brings you closer to the finish line but also can take you deeper into your own thoughts and relaxation. 

Now, I would like to share with you some pictures from my most significant hikes and walks that really are a part of who I'm today:

Bolivian Jungle

Around 2004, I went on a long hike in the jungles of Bolivia (a couple of hours drive from La Paz). It was an amazing experience where I met new people and formed meaningful connections. For a couple of days we walked through jungles, slept in remote areas, and relied on each other's trust to navigate the unknown. 

Isla Grande, Brazil

Another memorable hike from around 2004 was my visit to Isla Grande which is an island not far away from Rio De Janeiro. After settling down in the camping ground, I met two cool people which later became my friends. Shortly afterwards we decided to do a hike of 40 km to cross the island from bottom to top. I was the man of the day as I saved everyone by bringing "just in case" food in my bag. My friends thought we would find food in the middle of the jungle:). They returned a favor by searching for me when I got lost in the jungle (they found meüòâ). We finished our hike when we reached the tip of the island. The traditional dish of rice and beans was so tasty. For sure it was refreshing after eating Tuna, cookies and Goose liver Pate for five days.  The timing of arrival to the finish line was perfect as we got there just in time for the weekly ferry to the main village.

Luxembourg's Little Switzerland

Three years ago, I did the longest walk I've ever done in one day (30 Km). It was in the magnificent area of Luxembourg called "Little Switzerland." The trail resembled Switzerland's mountains and had stunning views. The focus wasn't just the amazing nature and yummy blackberries but also my state of mind during the hike. It was with certainty one of my most special days in my entire life:

That's how I look when I finish a 30 KM hike 

And it was such an amazing view:

I'm standing on a bridge over a swamp

 

and here are the tasty blackberries:

 

25 km walk

During my recent holiday, I decided to dedicate one day for a long walk. I walked on the beach or not far away from it for 7-8 hours. I tried to walk always in the shade of buildings as it was very hot. I constantly bought food, snacks, and drinks (which seems to be my favorite part of the walküòâ). 

This is how I looked after finishing the journey:

Moshe standing next to a tree after finishing 25 KM by foot

 

Running!

Recently, I started practicing for a race so I started running. Although I was already in shape from walking 15‚Äì20 km daily, running gave me a whole new feeling of energy:

After my first 12 KM run!

  and I really enjoy stopping in my favorite street and eating all sorts of fruits that are available for everyone:

Grapes

Recently I started to be interested in races. Here's a picture from a race that was raising funds for children with cancer:                                                                   

Moshe in a running race

Subscribe to this post as I'll add in the comments pictures from the upcoming race, after I complete it:).

Why did I start walking and running?

I really enjoy walking as it calms me down, excite me and keeps me in shape. It's a kind of meditation for me. Running is also very relaxing but at a different pace than walking. I hope I'll keep doing both for a long time, while doing it right to maintain a healthy body. Also starting a day with a morning run keeps you energized at least until lunch:).

Passing the baton:

Now, I'd like to hand it over to Achim ( @act45 ). Achim has been a community member for many years and I'm sure many of you know him. I was fortunate to meet Achim in person in SAP TechEd. Achim will share his amazing experiences and journey around being a yoga teacher and a Mindfulness enthusiastic. As I practice Mindfulness during my runs and walks, I think it's a great continuation for our blogging series.

Do you do long walks or hike? Share the pictures and stories behind them in the comments section. Feel free to share other hobbies you have! 

If you're interested in joining the series, please reach out to me via community@sap.com.

Let's get this journey going! I hope you all enjoy the great posts coming-up!

entry.title: üé§ Call for Speakers ‚Äì SAP Inside Track Pune 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community! üåü

We‚Äôre excited to announce that speaker registrations are now open for SAP Inside Track Pune 2025, happening on 11th October 2025 at SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune. üöÄ

After the overwhelming success of our first edition, we‚Äôre bringing the community together once again ‚Äì this time with a spotlight on Business AI in SAP.

Whether you are a developer, architect, consultant, partner, or customer, this is your opportunity to share your expertise and inspire the SAP community in Pune with your stories, experiences, and innovations.

‚ú® Topics for 2025

This year, we‚Äôre focusing on curated topic sessions around Business AI in SAP. We invite proposals in the following areas:

‚úîÔ∏è SAP AI Strategy & Roadmap
‚úîÔ∏è Embedded AI in SAP Solutions
‚úîÔ∏è Building with SAP AI Agents
‚úîÔ∏è Business AI Solutions (SAP)
‚úîÔ∏è SAP Business Data Cloud
‚úîÔ∏è SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)
‚úîÔ∏è AI Innovations: Partners & Customers

If you have experience, insights, or success stories in any of these topics, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

üîë Why Speak at SAP Inside Track Pune?

üé§ Showcase Your Expertise ‚Äì Share your journey, technical know-how, or innovative projects with a highly engaged SAP audience.
ü§ù Network with Peers ‚Äì Build connections with fellow professionals, partners, and community leaders.
üåç Inspire and Be Recognized ‚Äì Position yourself as a thought leader within the SAP community.
üí° Give Back ‚Äì Contribute to the growth of the community by sharing real-world insights.

üìÖ Event Details

  • Date: 11th October 2025

  • Venue: SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune

  • Time: 9 AM ‚Äì 5 PM IST

üì¢ Speaker Registration is Now Open!

üëâ Submit your proposal here: SIT Pune 2025 - Speaker Registration  

Next Steps: Once you submit your proposal,
Step 1: Our expert team will go through your proposal and if it is shortlisted, we will contact your for more details.
Step 2: This will again be discussed internally with the experts and once shortlisted, we will inform you about the next steps ‚Äì like presentation format, social media advertisement etc.,
We look forward to your valuable contributions and to seeing you at SAP Inside Track Pune 2025!
 
 
Best Regards,
SAP Community Pune Core Team

entry.title: SAPfluencer Award 2025 Exciting News !!
entry.content:
As an SAP Data & AI/ML Developer, mentor, and someone passionate about visibility in the SAP community, I‚Äôm thrilled to be part of the jury for the SAPfluencer Award 2025. This award celebrates people who make a real impact in the SAP ecosystem with their ideas, passion, and dedication.

üí°What the Award Is About

  • Visibility & Community ‚ú®
    Highlighting those who bring change in the SAP world‚Äîthrough innovation, community work, content creation, or advocacy.

  • Three Categories üèÜ

    1. Innovation & Tech

    2. Infotainment & Community Engagement

    3. Female Empowerment & Inspiration

  • How It Works üîç

    • Anyone can nominate (yourself or others)

    • The jury selects three finalists per category

    • The audience votes live at the award event

  • When & Where üìÖ
    November 20, 2025 in Bielefeld, at the Grand Stage of the Pioneers Theatre.

‚è≥Nominations Still Open

You can submit nominations until September 15, 2025. Don‚Äôt miss the chance to nominate someone from your network or even yourself!

üôåWhy It Matters

  • Encourages engagement in the SAP community

  • Promotes diversity and empowers underrepresented voices

  • Inspires with different ways to shape the SAP world

üìùMy Jury Perspective

When reviewing entries, I‚Äôll look at:

  • Relevance of contributions

  • Long-term impact

  • Innovation and boldness

  • Authenticity and influence

üöÄFinal Thoughts

The SAPfluencer Award 2025 is more than a prize. It‚Äôs a platform, a voice, and an opportunity to shape the future of the SAP community together.

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - Integration track sessions
entry.content:
We are days away from the first session of this year's Devtoberfest, our annual virtual celebration dedicated to the SAP developer community. Like previous years, there is a lot going on in the integration space, and as part of Devtoberfest 2025 we will have sessions covering the following topics: Architecture, AI, Event-driven Architectures, Tools for integration developers, open source and more.

As you might be aware, every track is assigned a unique day across the four weeks that Devtoberfest takes place and Wednesdays will be all about integration.

Devtoberfest 2025 sessions

You can find all the different tracks/sessions that are part of Devtoberfest here. You can filter all events by selecting the topic (label) you are interested in, e.g. integration üòâ.

Let me quickly share all the sessions that we will have as part of the integration track:

1st of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥Pipeline for Cloud Integration
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Clean Core, Event-Driven: Unlocking SAP Value with Advanced Event Mesh
  • 13:00 - üî¥ Designing understandable SAP BTP Solution Diagrams and contributing to the SAP Architecture Center
  • 15:00 - üî¥ IT System Landscape Transparency with Open Resource Discovery (ORD)

8th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ Warp-Speed for Event Creation: Overview on the new Event Add-on for ERP
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Hands-on session: practical demonstration of the Event Add-on for ERP
  • 13:30 - üî¥ Enterprise in Motion: Event-Driven Architecture Use Cases for Innovation and Agility
  • 17:00 - üî¥ Unleash Next-Generation Hybrid Integration with Edge Integration Cell

15th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Seamless side-by-side extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
  • 13:30 - üî¥SAP Cloud ALM - Integration & Exception Monitoring in Context for SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration)
  • 15:00 - üî¥ Partner Directory Accelerator Tool for Pipeline Concept - an SAP open-source project

22th of October:

  • 09:30 - üî¥ AI for Integration Excellence: Modernize, Optimize, Thrive
  • 11:00 - üî¥ Future-proof your scripts in SAP Cloud Integration
  • 13:30 - üî¥ A(P)I: Unified connectivity for AI applications using MCP

Note: If you click on any of the times of the sessions above, you will download the calendar invite for the session.

So go ahead and RSVP to the different sessions you are interested in. Also, make sure to download the calendar invites so that you don't miss the session and you can get a chance to ask the speaker any questions that you might have about the topic.

Happy learning this Devtoberfest 2025!

entry.title: SAP Community Voice: Exciting Blog Posts, Countdown for Devtoberfest, and More!
entry.content:
One of the best things about September so far is how our platform has many new improvements, active members, features for developers, location groups, and events. There are many reasons to explore and engage inside SAP Community, but this is the type of month that makes everyone feel more excited to learn, connect, and dive deeply into all topics related to SAP.

This SAP Community Voice newsletter highlights some of these updates, summarizes trending topics, explores details about Devtoberfest, and spotlights opportunities to participate in upcoming virtual and physical events, including SAP TechEd.

Read more below to find out what‚Äôs happening in and around SAP Community!

Featured Content

SAP ILM Store Configuration with Microsoft Azure Storage

If you are looking for organized and clear steps on how to configure SAP ILM store with Microsoft Azure Blob, we recommend this content written by @Rahul_Das65. This technical guide covers the prerequisites, authorizations required, certificates, and instructions for testing the connection in the end. To make your life easier, he made sure to include all the sources and useful documents as well.

Read the blog post

AI Agent ‚Äì First Release of the SAP Fiori MCP Server

This SAP Fiori MCP (Model Context Protocol) server marks a milestone in SAP‚Äôs AI journey by introducing open-source tools for AI coding assistants that you create. In this post, @Christoph_Gollmick explains how MCP helps with large language models (LLMs) to ensure the most reliable results, while also supporting all developers by providing a faster and efficient experience when generating and adapting applications.

Read the blog post

Lessons on SAP Datasphere Architecture

Thinking about building a data solution with SAP Datasphere? This blog post by @haungo can be very helpful. He walks through the steps -- from an initial design to a final, more robust architecture. ‚ÄúLessons learned‚Äù content is always valuable because it provides the insights from the ups and downs of real-world projects.

Read the blog post

New GenAI Feature Available for SAP Integration Suite Version 6.69

SAP¬¥s @DeepakGDeshpande shares details about the new Generative AI based Integration Flow Generation with Mediations Steps feature that boosts the efficiency of the development process. The feature is currently available for the premium edition in specific regions/data centers, but SAP will add more as the rollout of the software feature continues.

Read the blog post

Community News

More Kudos, More Badges

If you‚Äôre an active member who supports other members by giving them kudos, we are now acknowledging your engagement efforts with a new badge progression set. You‚Äôll earn the first badge in the set with your very first kudo, then receive more badges after giving 30 kudos, then 75, 200, and 500 as the final milestone. Check more details in this What‚Äôs New post, which provides a full overview about how this simple act makes such a big impact for our community.

New Design Pilot: We Still Need Your Feedback

In our last edition of SAP Community Voice, we mentioned how we were running a pilot to test a new layout for blog posts that removes widgets and white spaces from the right column, as a way to make the reading experience better. This feature will be available until September 23, so that means another week for you to give us your opinion! You can read more about the pilot in this post and share your feedback in the comments.

New Location Group in Africa

We are so happy that our Middle East and Africa location groups are growing this year. This month we would like to welcome our new Nigeria group, curated by @CharledNwankwo, who has been an active member since 2020. Check now his first blog post on the group here. If you also live in this area, make sure to register to learn and connect with other members from your region and to support future physical events across Nigeria.

Josh Bentley Is Our SAP Community Team Spotlight for September 2025

Our SAP Community team spotlight series features interviews with the SAP colleagues dedicated to our community platform and our members, online and in-person. This month, we are super happy to highlight @josh_bentley (maybe you know him as Josh ‚ÄúBlueBeard‚Äù). In his interview with @fatemehzarei_001, Josh gives the details behind the idea of his iconic colorful beard, explains how he got involved with SAP Community, talks about his current role, and offers advice for those new to SAP and the community. Read the full interview and look for other interviews in the series, spotlighting Anne Kathrine Petteroe, Moshe Naveh, and Laura Schmitz,

New SAP Community Hobbies Series!

Last week, SAP's @moshenaveh launched a new blog series designed to shine a light on the hobbies and passions of community members. The main goal is to encourage you to share a bit about yourself. What topics bring you joy, keep you motivated, and help you balance your life? Participation in this series is a great way to connect with and inspire other members. Starting the series with this post, Moshe highlights walking and hiking, and we want to encourage you to read it and learn more about his adventures. If you have a cool hobby, please join the series and share your story with the community. We would love to hear about it!

Upcoming Events

The Countdown Is On: Two Weeks to Devtoberfest 2025

Is everyone ready for the most expected tech virtual festival? Because Devtoberfest is right around the corner to kick off the big SAP TechEd season! Starting on September 29, this free and online event will be full of sessions and activities, covering different topics such as ABAP, fronted tooling, AI innovations, and CAP. Beyond the educational content, the participants can play around with the fun activities prepared for Devtoberfest (and do not require you to show up at a specific time, allowing you more flexibility to take part in everything). Oh, and let¬¥s not forget that the competition is on, and you should definitely check out all the rules and prizes for the Devtoberfest 2025 Contest.

SAP TechEd Agenda Builder

For all our members who are planning to attend SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin next month and need help to plan on what are the best options to participate (we know it is hard to choose with more than 250 different great sessions), we highly recommend the online agenda builder. This tool allows you to browse through all the sessions available, including keynotes, workshops, roadmaps, and much more. It is very simple to add the ones you are interested in attending to your dashboard and have a clear and clean view. This feature is also available for those participating in SAP TechEd Virtual, so you can plan your schedule whether you're joining in person or online.

SAP Inside Track Around the World

In our last SAP Community Voice newsletter, we highlighted that it's now easier to find local events using the new filter "Country‚Äù. This new feature helps you discover events not directly linked to a location group (e.g., Portugal and Mexico meet-ups can be found even if not represented by a group), as well as events in these groups. Perhaps, if you explore the list, you will see how many SAP Inside Tracks are going to happen in the next two weeks. We highly recommend that you attend if you are looking to connect in person with other members in your area. To help you find these upcoming events more easily: SAP Inside Track Belgium, SAP Inside Track Warsaw, SAP Inside Track Philadelphia, SAP Inside Track Hamburg, SAP Inside Track Porto, SAP SIT RS (Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil).

entry.title: The International 2025 ‚Äì Review of TI14 with SAP & Team Liquid
entry.content:
The International 2025 ‚Äì Review of TI14 with SAP & Team Liquid

From September 11 to 14, 2025, the Barclays Arena in Hamburg became the center of the esports world. The International 2025 (TI14), the most important Dota 2 tournament of the year, brought together the 16 best teams. In addition to the legendary Aegis of Champions, a total prize pool of $2,694,437 was up for grabs ‚Äì funded by Valve's base pool plus community purchases in the Dota client.

Prize pool distribution (Top 4)

Team Falcons ‚Äì approx. $1,181,757 (43.9% of the pool)
ü•àXtreme Gaming ‚Äì approx. $305,163
ü•âPARiVISION ‚Äì approx. $192,000
4Ô∏è‚É£BetBoom Team ‚Äì approx. $128,000
The remaining teams received smaller prize money depending on their ranking.


Viewership & Reach

Peak Viewers: 1.77 million concurrent viewers in the Grand Final.
üìäAverage Viewers: approximately 835,000 over the entire event.
üåçTI14 was broadcast in more than 20 languages worldwide.

This makes TI14 the third most popular Dota 2 event of all time, just behind TI10 and TI11.

Stadium at The International 2025Team LiquidStadiumPublic View on the Ongoing GamesPublic View on the Ongoing Games


SAP & Team Liquid ‚Äì Data in Esports

SAP has been working with Team Liquid since 2018, bringing business technology to gaming:

SAP HANA analytics helped Liquid evaluate over 500,000 draft scenarios and better understand opponents' strategies.
Liquid used statistical models to calculate hero pick probabilities ‚Äì similar to sales or demand forecasts in business.
Even though they didn't make it into the top 4 this year, Liquid was able to show several times during the tournament how data-driven strategies influence drafts and early-game decisions.


Tournament progress ‚Äì facts and figures

16 teams started in the group stage, which was played using the Swiss system.
A total of 51 matches were played, with an average game duration of 42 minutes.
Longest game: 77 minutes in the lower bracket, a real thriller that tested the nerves of both players and fans.
Most picked hero: Shadow Demon (48 picks, 56% win rate).
Highest KDA (kills/deaths/assists): A Falcons player with 14.2 in the Grand Final.


Significance & outlook

TI14 proved that esports and technology are increasingly converging.
For SAP, the partnership with Team Liquid is a showcase for data-driven innovation.
For fans, Hamburg was a worthy venue with a spine-tingling atmosphere.
TI15 will take place in Shanghai in 2026 ‚Äì a venue traditionally known for its vocal fans and gigantic arenas.

 

Conclusion

With over $2.6 million in prize money, nearly 2 million live viewers, and thrilling best-of-five series, TI14 was a worthy milestone in Dota 2 history.
Team Falcons will go down in history as the 2025 champions, while Team Liquid, with the help of SAP data analytics, proves that modern esports is not just about reaction time and instinct ‚Äì but also big data and smart strategy.
